pullRequest.body:
Defines `pdf` in terms of `rnDeriv`.

Main definition change:
```lean
/-- A random variable `X : Œ© ‚Üí E` is said to `HasPDF` with respect to the measure `‚Ñô` on `Œ©` and
`Œº` on `E` if the push-forward measure of `‚Ñô` along `X` is absolutely continuous with respect to
`Œº` and they `HaveLebesgueDecomposition`. -/
class HasPDF {m : MeasurableSpace Œ©} (X : Œ© ‚Üí E) (‚Ñô : Measure Œ©)
    (Œº : Measure E := by volume_tac) : Prop where
  pdf' : Measurable X ‚àß HaveLebesgueDecomposition (map X ‚Ñô) Œº ‚àß map X ‚Ñô ‚â™ Œº

/-- If `X` is a random variable that `HasPDF X ‚Ñô Œº`, then `pdf X` is the Radon‚ÄìNikodym
derivative of the push-forward measure of `‚Ñô` along `X` with respect to `Œº`. -/
def pdf {_ : MeasurableSpace Œ©} (X : Œ© ‚Üí E) (‚Ñô : Measure Œ©) (Œº : Measure E := by volume_tac) :
    E ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû :=
  if HasPDF X ‚Ñô Œº then (map X ‚Ñô).rnDeriv Œº else 0
```

The law of the unconscious statistician is first generalized to `rnDeriv` on a general Banach space (`‚à´ x, (Œº.rnDeriv ŒΩ x).toReal ‚Ä¢ f x ‚àÇŒΩ = ‚à´ x, f x ‚àÇŒº`), and then proven for PDFs.

[Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Definition.20of.20pdf.20as.20rnDeriv)

---

nodes.body: For now two things I am not sure of are: should there be an `if` at all in the definition of `pdf` (though we can always change that later), and where to place the lemmas about ‚à´gdŒº = ‚à´g(dŒº/dŒΩ)dŒΩ.

@JasonKYi I definitely agree with changing it to ae measurable, and it in fact makes many properties much better. In particular I think I can define `pdf` to be unconditionally (without the `if HasPDF`) since `map X` is 0 when X not AEMeasurable, and `rnDeriv` is also 0 when not HaveLebesgueDecomposition. And then I can prove some theorems for pdf in general, though most of them will be specific to when `map X ‚Ñô ‚â™ Œº` and AEMeasurable X and HaveLebesgueDecomposition, i.e. `HasPDF`. I will try to update to do this and see if anything breaks
@JasonKYi Thank you for the suggestions! I implemented the changes.

Thanks!

Thanks!

Can you relax the measurability condition to ae measurable
For this and the other theorems, should I create a two theorems, one for measurable and one for ae measurable, or should I only keep the ae measurable theorem?
I would only keep the ae measurable theorems as it is easy to get ae measurable from measurable
Great, that is what I did in the new commits
Same as above
It was decided that even in probability theory, we should stick with ae measurable instead of measurable, so can you change the definition to require ae measurable instead?
You probably don't need to unfold here

```suggestion
  rw [pdf, map_of_not_aemeasurable hX]
```
Untested

```suggestion
    (Œº : Measure E := by volume_tac) : Œº.withDensity (pdf X ‚Ñô Œº) ‚â§ map X ‚Ñô := withDensity_rnDeriv_le _ _
```
Untested
Since `pdf_def` is true by `rfl`, the proof should work without unfolding the definition with rewrite

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Probability/Density): define pdf using rnDeriv

nodes.body: For now two things I am not sure of are: should there be an `if` at all in the definition of `pdf` (though we can always change that later), and where to place the lemmas about ‚à´gdŒº = ‚à´g(dŒº/dŒΩ)dŒΩ.

@JasonKYi I definitely agree with changing it to ae measurable, and it in fact makes many properties much better. In particular I think I can define `pdf` to be unconditionally (without the `if HasPDF`) since `map X` is 0 when X not AEMeasurable, and `rnDeriv` is also 0 when not HaveLebesgueDecomposition. And then I can prove some theorems for pdf in general, though most of them will be specific to when `map X ‚Ñô ‚â™ Œº` and AEMeasurable X and HaveLebesgueDecomposition, i.e. `HasPDF`. I will try to update to do this and see if anything breaks
@JasonKYi Thank you for the suggestions! I implemented the changes.

Thanks!
